plants.name: Monstera (Monstera deliciosa)
plants.zone: Suitable for zones 10-12; commonly grown as a houseplant in other zones.
plants.fact: Monstera, also known as the Swiss Cheese Plant, is a popular tropical plant known for its unique and fenestrated leaves.
plants.soilType: Well-draining potting mix with organic matter; prefers slightly moist soil.
plants.flowering: Monstera plants may produce flowers, but they are typically inconspicuous. The plant is more renowned for its large, split leaves that develop as it matures.

plants.name: Snake Plant (Sansevieria)
plants.zone: Adaptable to a wide range of zones; tolerant of different climates.
plants.fact: Snake plants, also known as Mother-in-Law's Tongue, are popular indoor plants valued for their hardiness and air-purifying qualities.
plants.soilType: Well-draining potting mix; can tolerate various soil conditions but prefers slightly dry conditions.
plants.flowering: Snake plants produce tall spikes with small, fragrant, greenish-white flowers, although they may not bloom frequently when grown indoors as houseplants.

plants.name: Pothos (Epipremnum aureum)
plants.zone: Suitable for a wide range of zones; adaptable to different climates.
plants.fact: Pothos is a popular and easy-to-care-for houseplant known for its trailing vines and heart-shaped leaves.
plants.soilType: Well-draining potting mix; can thrive in various soil conditions.
plants.flowering: Pothos plants are grown for their attractive foliage and are not primarily known for their flowers. However, they may produce small, inconspicuous blooms in the right conditions.

plants.name: Fig
plants.fact: Fig trees are known for their sweet and nutritious fruit called figs.
plants.soilType: Well-draining soil, preferably sandy loam or loamy soil.
plants.flowering: Fig trees produce small, insignificant flowers that are actually inside the fruit, not externally visible.

plants.name: Aglaonema
plants.zone: Generally grown as a houseplant; not cold-tolerant and thrives in warm indoor conditions.
plants.fact: Aglaonema, also known as Chinese Evergreen, is a popular and low-maintenance indoor plant valued for its attractive foliage and air-purifying qualities.
plants.soilType: Well-draining potting mix with organic matter; prefers slightly moist soil but should not be waterlogged.
plants.flowering: Aglaonema can produce small, inconspicuous flowers, but it is primarily grown for its colorful and variegated leaves, which come in various patterns and shades.
